servinfo.title: Radiator Cooling Fan Control System Check

entry.ptxt: Radiator sub fan motor ground circuit
Radiator cooling fan relay No.1 power supply circuit (switch side)
Radiator cooling fan relay No.2 power supply circuit (switch side)
Radiator cooling fan relay No.3 power supply circuit (switch side)
Radiator cooling main fan motor drive circuit
Radiator cooling sub fan motor drive circuit
Radiator cooling fan relay No.3 ground circuit

attention1.ptxt: Keep hands, tools, and clothing away from radiator cooling fan to prevent personal injury. This fan is driven by electric motor that can turn on whether or not the engine is running. The fan motor can start automatically in response to ECT sensor signal if ignition switch is at “ON” position.

item.ptxt: For details about engine cooling fan operation, refer to Cooling Fan Description:J24B .
Before beginning troubleshooting, be sure to read Precautions for ECM Circuit Inspection:J24B .
When measuring circuit voltage, resistance and/or pulse signal of ECM, connect the special tool between ECM and ECM connectors.

test1.ptxt: Turn OFF ignition switch and connect SUZUKI scan tool to data link connector (DLC).
Turn ignition switch to ON position and check DTC.

action.ptxt: Go to applicable DTC flow and recheck.
Go to Step 2.

testgroup.title: Radiator cooling fan low mode control check

test1.ptxt: Check radiator cooling fan control for low mode.

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 3.
Go to Step 6.

testgroup.title: Radiator cooling fan mid and high mode control check

test1.ptxt: Check radiator cooling fan control for mid and high mode.

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

action.ptxt: Radiator cooling fan control system is in good condition.
Go to Step 4.

testgroup.title: Radiator cooling fan relay No.2 power supply circuit (switch side) check

test1.ptxt: Turn OFF ignition switch and remove radiator cooling fan relay No.2 from relay box.
Check for proper connection to radiator cooling fan relay No.2 at each terminal.
If OK, measure voltage between radiator cooling fan relay No.2 power supply circuit (A2) and vehicle body ground.

testgroup.question: Is it 10 – 14 V?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace radiator cooling fan relay No.2 power supply circuit (switch side).

testgroup.title: Radiator cooling fan relay No.3 ground circuit check

test1.ptxt: Turn OFF ignition switch and remove radiator cooling fan relay No.3 from relay box.
Check for proper connection to radiator cooling fan relay No.3 at each terminal.
If OK, measure resistance between radiator cooling fan relay No.3 ground circuit (C1) and vehicle body ground.

testgroup.question: Is resistance 3Ω or less?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace radiator cooling fan relay No.3 ground circuit.

testgroup.title: Radiator cooling fan relay No.1 power supply circuit (switch side) check

test1.ptxt: Turn OFF ignition switch and remove radiator cooling fan relay No.1 from relay box.
Check for proper connection to radiator cooling fan relay No.1 at each terminal.
If OK, measure voltage between radiator cooling fan relay No.1 power supply circuit (A1) and vehicle body ground.

testgroup.question: Is it 10 – 14 V?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 7.
Repair or replace radiator cooling fan relay No.1 power supply circuit (switch side).

testgroup.title: Radiator cooling fan relay No.1, No.2 and No.3 check

test1.ptxt: Check radiator cooling fan relay No.1, No.2 and No.3.

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 8.
Replace faulty radiator cooling fan relay.

testgroup.title: Main fan motor drive circuit check

test1.ptxt: Turin OFF ignition switch and disconnect main fan motor connector.
Check for proper connection to main fan motor at each terminal.
If OK, check that main fan motor drive circuit (B1) is in the following conditions.

item.ptxt: Wiring harness resistance of main fan motor drive circuit is less than 3 Ω or less.
Insulation resistance between main fan drive circuit and vehicle body ground is infinity.
Circuit voltage of main fan motor drive circuit is 0 – 1 V with ignition switch in ON position.

testgroup.question: Are they in good condition?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 9.
Repair or replace main fan motor drive circuit.

testgroup.title: Radiator cooling fan relay No.3 power supply circuit (switch side) check

test1.ptxt: Check that radiator cooling fan relay No.3 power supply circuit (switch side) (A3) is in the following conditions.

item.ptxt: Wiring harness resistance of radiator cooling fan relay No.3 power supply circuit (switch side) is 3 Ω or less.
Insulation resistance between radiator cooling fan relay No.3 power supply circuit (switch side) and vehicle body ground is infinity.
Circuit voltage of radiator cooling fan relay No.3 power supply circuit (switch side) is 0 – 1 V with ignition switch in ON position.

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 10.
Repair or replace radiator cooling fan relay No.3 power supply circuit (switch side).

testgroup.title: Sub fan motor drive circuit check

test1.ptxt: Turn OFF ignition switch and disconnect sub fan motor connector.
Check for proper connection to sub fan motor at each terminal.
If OK, check that sub fan motor drive circuit (B2) is in the following conditions.

item.ptxt: Wiring harness resistance of sub fan motor drive circuit is 3 Ω or less.
Insulation resistance between sub fan drive circuit and vehicle body ground is infinity.
Circuit voltage of sub fan motor drive circuit is 0 – 1 V with ignition switch in ON position.

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 11.
Repair or replace sub fan motor drive circuit.

testgroup.title: Sub fan motor ground circuit check

test1.ptxt: Measure resistance between sub fan motor ground circuit (C2) and vehicle body ground.

testgroup.question: Is resistance 3Ω or less?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 12.
Repair or replace sub fan motor ground circuit.

testgroup.title: Main fan motor and sub fan motor check

test1.ptxt: Check main fan motor and sub fan motor.

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
Replace main fan motor or sub fan motor.
